intro: Hechtia vicesphaeroblasta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hechtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces striking, tubular inflorescences that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are narrow, fleshy, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Hechtia vicesphaeroblasta is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
